note.p: Birth: Lea, near Gainsborough, Lincolnshire, England (1689)
Death: The Master's Lodge, Trinity College, Cambridge (02 February 1768)
Education: Mr Thomas's School at Leicester; Trinity College, Cambridge; BA (1712), MA (1715), LLD (1723), DD (Lit Reg 1739)

Career: Assistant to his cousin; Fellow of Trinity (1714); Tutor at Trinity (1715-1734); Plumian Professor of Astronomy at Cambridge (1716-1760); ordained deacon and priest (1738); Vice Chancellor of Cambridge (1742-1743); Master of Trinity (1742-1768); benefactor of Cambridge University
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; DSB; Venn
L B Glyn, 'Israel Lyons: a short but starry career. The life of an eighteenth-century Jewish botanist and astronomer' in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 275-305
